Package com.bluegosling.concurrent

Classes that extend and enhance the API provided by the java.util.concurrent package.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Awaitable
    An object that represents a future event.
    Cancellable
    Represents an activity that can be cancelled.
    CompletableExecutorService
    An executor service that returns CompletableFutures.
    CompletionStageFuture<T>
    A Future that also provides the fluent API of CompletionStage.
    ContextPropagator<T>
    An object that helps propagate context from one thread to another.
    FutureListener<T>
    A listener for the completion of a future.
    FutureVisitor<T>
    Interface for the visitor pattern with ListenableFutures.
    HierarchicalLock.AcquiredLock
    The result of acquiring a HierarchicalLock.
    InterceptingExecutor.Decorator
    A decorator, that can perform actions before and after each task.
    InterceptingExecutor.Interceptor
    An interceptor for tasks.
    InterceptingExecutorService.Decorator
    A decorator, that can perform actions before and after each task.
    InterceptingExecutorService.Interceptor
    An interceptor for tasks.
    ListenableExecutorService
    An executor service that returns ListenableFutures.
    ListenableFuture<T>
    The future to end all futures.
    ListenableRepeatingFuture<T>
    A ListenableScheduledFuture that represents a repeating task.
    ListenableScheduledExecutorService
    A scheduled executor service that returns ListenableFutures.
    ListenableScheduledFuture<T>
    A future that is both scheduled and listenable.
    ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier<T>
    Like a Supplier, except allowed to throw an InterruptedException.
    ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleSupplier<T>
    Similar to ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier, but accepts a time limit argument and can throw a TimeoutException if the given time limit elapses before the result value is available.
    ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleWait
    A function that waits up to a given limit for some event.
    RunnableCompletionStageFuture<T>
    A combination of RunnableFuture and CompletionStageFuture.
    RunnableListenableFuture<T>
    A combination of RunnableFuture and ListenableFuture.
    Scheduled
    A specialization of Delayed that allows for more accurate comparisons between the time at which instances are scheduled.
    SerializingExecutor<K>
    An executor that serializes multiple tasks that correspond to the same key.

    A ListenableFuture implementation that is suitable for sub-classing.

    Provides a framework for implementing blocking locks and related synchronizer that rely on FIFO wait queues.

    A thread pool that runs multiple sequential streams.

    An executor that allows for propagation of context from submitting threads to worker threads.

    A scheduled executor service that allows for propagation of context from submitting threads to worker threads.

    A concurrency mechanism allowing concurrent readers and an exclusive writer.

    Represents a duration of time that is backed by an integral length and a unit.
    FutureTuples  
    HierarchicalLock
    A hierarchical lock that supports shared and exclusive locking modes and supports lock promotion and demotion.
    InterceptingExecutor
    An executor that provides an interceptor pattern, to apply cross-cutting concerns in the course of executing tasks.
    InterceptingExecutor.Decorator.Builder
    Builds a decorator, composing up to three functional interfaces.
    InterceptingExecutor.Interceptor.ListBuilder
    Builds a list of interceptors.
    InterceptingExecutorService
    An executor service that provides an interceptor pattern, to apply cross-cutting concerns in the course of executing tasks.
    InterceptingExecutorService.Decorator.Builder
    Builds a decorator, composing up to three functional interfaces.
    InterceptingExecutorService.Interceptor.ListBuilder
    Builds a list of interceptors.
    InterceptingScheduledExecutorService
    A InterceptingExecutorService that provides the facility to schedule tasks.
    InterruptibleCompletableFuture<T>
    A CompletableFuture that provides a mechanism for interrupting an in-progress computation when the future is cancelled.
    ListenableFutureTask<T>
    A future task that implements the ListenableFuture interface.
    ListenableRepeatingFutureTask<T>  
    ListenableScheduledFutureTask<T>  
    ManagedBlockers
    Numerous utility methods related to blocking using ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers.
    NonReentrantLock
    A non-reentrant lock.
    PipeliningExecutor<K>
    An executor that runs multiple sequential pipelines.
    RateLimitedBlockingQueue<E>  
    RateLimiter  
    ReadOnlyCompletableFuture<T>
    A completable future whose public API is read-only.
    RunnableCompletableFuture<T>
    A completable future that represents a task.
    RunnableReadOnlyCompletableFuture<T>
    A read-only completable future that represents a task.
    SameThreadExecutor
    A simple executor that runs each task synchronously in the same thread that submits it.
    SettableFuture<T>
    A future whose result is set programmatically.
    SettableRunnableFuture<T>
    A runnable future that is also settable.
    SimpleFutureVisitor<T>
    A simple visitor implementation that is suitable for sub-classing.
    SimpleFutureVisitor.Builder<T>
    A builder for constructing visitors from Consumers and Runnables.
    SpinLock
    A non-reentrant and unfair lock that "spins" while waiting to lock.
    ThreadFactories
    Utility methods for creating thread factories.
    ThreadLimitingExecutorService
    An executor service that uses threads from another executor but imposes limits on parallelism and the number of threads used for its tasks.
    WorkSharingThreadPool  
    WrappingExecutor
    An executor that provides a way to wrap tasks that are executed.
    WrappingExecutorService
    An executor service that provides a way to wrap tasks that are executed.
    WrappingScheduledExecutorService
    A scheduled executor service that provides a way to wrap tasks that are executed.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    DeadlockException
    An unchecked exception that is thrown when a lock acquisition is attempted that would result in deadlock.
    ReentranceException
    An exception indicating that a reentrant lock acquisition was attempted but is not unsupported.

Package com.bluegosling.concurrent Description

Classes that extend and enhance the API provided by the java.util.concurrent package. Of particular note:

ListenableFuture

This interface is a Future that allows completion callbacks to be registered. This means code has the flexibility of either doing things asynchronously with callbacks or synchronously by blocking for the future to complete. It also provides numerous other new methods to greatly improve the ease of use of futures. This interface is accompanied by several classes with useful static methods to further expand the types of tasks you can perform using futures.

SerializingExecutor

An executor that maintains multiple queues, each identified by a "key". Tasks associated with the same key run sequentially. Tasks associated different keys can run concurrently. There are two implementations provided. One that wraps a given executor and enforces the parallelism and sequencing independent of the underlying execution mechanism, and another that is a novel thread pool implementation.

HierarchicalLock

A lock that is similar to a ReadWriteLock except that it also provides a lock hierarchy. Acquiring a lock (in any mode) requires acquiring the lock's parent in shared (e.g. "read") mode. This is similar to locking constructs in RDBMSs, where you have related locks for a database, a table, and a record in a table.
